item.title: Traditional SEM overly focuses on LISREL equations to the detriment of dealing with measurement error
item.description: So I don’t listen to the Quantitude podcast. It’s really difficult for me to get into it when my playlist includes podcasts with episodes titles like: Interstellar Jihad. However, I saw several tweets inspired by the SEM vs. regression episode. And I have too many thoughts, opinions, feelings to stay quiet. I lay them out here. SEM is regression A case of cultural differences The actual difference is LISREL But too much LISREL, not enough measurement error LISREL works well for normal-data normal-model no manifest covariates models Covariance matrix -> LISREL likely fails with discrete indicators LISREL likely fails for SEMs with observed covariates (e.
